text: it's April and the royal wedding is just
around the corner this is Christine
honey for the New York Times Sean rabba
do is a wedding planner in New York who
often works with celebrity clients so
what are the biggest issues right now in
a celebrity wedding and a wedding of
this caliber so many people want to know
what is going to happen what the dress
is going to look like what the flowers
are going to look like the cake and so
the paparazzi are really out there and
they are at you know high alert to get
what they can because the public wants
to know about it and and some ways to
maybe alleviate some of those things
leaking out is to come up with a plan a
a plan B maybe even a plan C of how
you're going to get Katherine in the
vehicle from wherever she's staying to
the church without being seen if that's
what they want to do maybe it's you know
not the real dress that she's wearing
when she leaves and she changes when she
gets to the church Kate Middleton hopes
to keep the wedding dress designer a
secret until the wedding day and how do
you keep people who are working on the
wedding from speaking about although
kind of wonderful and delicious details
by asking them to sign confidentiality
agreements and not only that but the
people that are working on the wedding
the vendors and whatnot they find it in
honor to be doing so and they want to
respect that
while 3,500 guests attended Prince
Charles and Diana's wedding in 1981 just
1900 invitations have gone out for this
one so tell me how the expectations are
different for a wedding of this caliber
there was a portion of the public that
was disappointed with the invitation
that they sent out it was very simple it
was very it was classic I think that the
public has a perception that with a
royal grand wedding that the invitation
itself would have been large and and
fabulous and ornate the 18 carat diamond
in blue sapphire engagement ring was a
way for Prince William to honor his late
mother how do you handle in weddings
like this when a parent is not going to
be attending in this case you know for
the groom with Princess Diana not being
there there are several ways to handle
that you definitely want to address the
fact that the member of the family is
not there but you don't want to draw a
lot of attention to it you don't want to
make it a sad day so you know one way to
do that is maybe to mention it in a
prayer at the church maybe mention it in
the program if Prince Harry is giving
the speech touch upon it but don't dwell
upon it Prince William's brother Prince
Harry will be his best man and Kate's
sister Pippa Middleton will be her maid
of honor so what are the bride and groom
now a few weeks before the royal wedding
what are their biggest stresses the
biggest things on their mind right now
for the bride it's going to be the dress
doing the dress fittings you know
sometimes the bride gets nervous and it
may not eat right may lose weight may
gain weight and so that that can be
quite stressful another thing that can
be stressful is starting to do the
seating assignments because you want to
make sure that you're putting all of the
right people in the right place you're
not offending anyone and especially with
a royal wedding like this there's
protocol the cost of security for the
wedding is estimated to be more than 30
million dollars how do you handle
gift-giving in something like this you
know chances are that Katherine and
William already have a lot of what they
need you know they don't need the
Cuisinart mixer so asking guests to
donate to their favor
charity is a great way you know to sort
of do the gift
